sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

sentences.english: Then, when much blood had clogged their chariot-wheels, I would go up and wash them from sweet wells, Even with truths that lie too deep for taint.
sentences.chinese: 因此当大量的血液凝固，阻塞了战车前进的轮之际，我就要起身，用甘甜清澈的井水刷洗猩红，甚至是用深深隐藏在污点后的事实。

sentences.english: When humans first started building things, determining whether they would work as planned was mostly a matter of trial and error. Build a bridge, drive a chariot across it, and see if it collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 一开始人类建造房屋时,决定房屋是否合格的方法是去试一下,看看有什么不妥的地方.建成一座桥,把辆战车开上面跑一跑,看看桥会不会倒.

sentences.english: I drove my chariot to the vineyard gate, and there I saw the twoKings.
sentences.chinese: 我驾着战车来到葡萄园的门口，看到了那两个国王。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with two wheels pulled by a horse, used in ancient times in battles and races

detailed_translations.chinese: 驾驭（过去式charioted，过去分词charioted，现在分词charioting，第三人称单数chariots）

sentences.english: pilgrims visiting a holy shrine
sentences.chinese: 祭拜圣庙的朝圣者

detailed_translations.chinese: 朝圣者；漫游者；（美）最初的移民
detailed_translations.english: a religious person who travels a long way to a holy place

sentences.english: He stepped out on to the narrow ledge and, holding the frame, stretched across to wipe away the annoying smudge.
sentences.chinese: 他走出狭窄的窗台上，抓着窗框，探身出去擦去那烦人的污迹。

sentences.english: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.
sentences.chinese: 神要擦去他们一切的眼泪。 不再有死亡，也不再有悲哀，哭号，疼痛，因为以前的事都过去了。

sentences.english: doesn't wipe away a lipstick smudge in the presence of the woman who planted it on him.
sentences.chinese: 不会当着女人的面擦掉她留在他脸上的唇印，而是把它当成一种荣幸而留着它，即使时间很短。

sentences.english: She needed to confess her sins and ask for forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她需要忏悔罪过，请求宽恕。

sentences.english: He knew that he had committed a terrible sin .
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己犯下了可怕的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: an action that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God
to do something that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God

sentences.english: ...sheltering from a sudden downpour of rain.
sentences.chinese: …躲避一场突如其来的瓢泼大雨。

detailed_translations.english: a lot of rain that falls in a short time

sentences.english: The pumps were started and the crew began to douse the fire with water.
sentences.chinese: 抽水机启动了，船员们开始用水将火浇灭。

detailed_translations.english: to stop a fire from burning by pouring water on it

sentences.english: A smouldering cigarette can kindle a devastating bushfire.
sentences.chinese: 闷燃着的香烟会引起毁灭性的林区大火。

sentences.english: She imagined that she could be happy here, at least for as long as she could avoid any calamity like the bushfire that had chased her from her last home.
sentences.chinese: 她想自己会在这里住得很开心，至少住到她能躲避丛林大火之类的灾难，上一回搬家就是因为一场丛林大火。

sentences.english: All we need for a little perspective at the moment (Feb, 2009) is to watch the TV (here in Australia) and listen to the bushfire survivors talk for a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 当时（2009年2月），我们需要的一个小小的思考就是看电视（在澳大利亚），听森林大火的幸存者讲述的那些时间。

detailed_translations.english: an uncontrolled fire in the bush; a scrub or forest fire

sentences.english: a fortnight’s holiday
sentences.chinese: 十四天的假期

sentences.english: in a fortnight’s time
sentences.chinese: 两周后

sentences.english: a fortnight ago
sentences.chinese: 两周前

detailed_translations.english: two weeks

sentences.english: I ordered the evacuation of all Americans and sent troops to guarantee their safety.
sentences.chinese: 我下令撤离所有的美国人，并派部队去保证他们的安全。

sentences.english: The impact of evacuation and relocation on those with health or functional impairments can be tremendous .
sentences.chinese: 撤离和重新安置对这些健康状况欠佳或身体残疾的人影响极大。

sentences.english: However, it is not only harmful to escape, but also beneficial for smoke to spread quickly to other floors if the smoke moves into the vertical escape evacuation routes while it is on fire.
sentences.chinese: 但是火灾发生后，作为人员逃生的竖向疏散通道如果遭受烟气侵害，不仅对人员的逃生不利，而且会加快烟气向其他楼层的蔓延。

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

sentences.english: The entire telecom sector has been suffering from a lack of sales.
sentences.chinese: 整个电信部门一直在经受销售不景气之苦。

sentences.english: The telecom industry in Australia is very small in comparison with the rest of the world.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚电信业与世界其他地区电信业相比规模很小。

detailed_translations.english: Telecom is short for

sentences.english: their geographical proximity to Japan (= nearness to Japan )
sentences.chinese: 它们和日本相邻的地理位置

detailed_translations.english: relating to the place in an area, country etc where something or someone is

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

sentences.english: Tom’s mother was highly critical of the school’s approach.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的母亲对学校的处理方法持强烈的批评态度。

sentences.english: highly competitive industries
sentences.chinese: 竞争非常激烈的行业

sentences.english: a highly desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 宜居的街区

sentences.english: T.S. Eliot’s highly influential poem, ‘The Waste Land’ T.S.
sentences.chinese: 艾略特极有影响力的诗作《荒原》

sentences.english: a highly developed economy
sentences.chinese: 高度发达的经济

detailed_translations.english: very

sentences.english: It improves the strength and mobility of joints.
sentences.chinese: 它能提高关节的力量和灵活性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

sentences.english: Are you the average business owner or freelancer like I am?
sentences.chinese: 你是像我一样的中型企业主或者自由作家吗？

sentences.english: When one client takes all your time that is a boss and you have a job, not a client and freelancer relationship.
sentences.chinese: 当客户占光你的时间的时候，你们是老板和员工的关系，而非客户和自由职业者。

sentences.english: There are a lot of benefits of moving ahead from simply being a freelancer. But there are quite a few risks involved too.
sentences.chinese: 比起只是简单地成为一名自由职业者，成立自己的公司有非常多的好处，当然也涉及一些风险。

detailed_translations.english: A freelancer is someone who does freelance work

sentences.english: The government divides asylum seekers into economic migrants and genuine refugees.
sentences.chinese: 政府将寻求政治庇护的人划分为经济移民和真正的难民。

detailed_translations.chinese: 移居者， 移民； 候鸟， 迁移动物
detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

sentences.english: The price of home ownership is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 房价在不断上涨。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of owning something

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

sentences.english: a famous film clip which has been shown countless times
sentences.chinese: 播放了无数次的一段著名电影选段

detailed_translations.english: too many to be counted

name: indispensable
trans: 不可缺少的，绝对必要的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

sentences.english: Tillicum: I long for freedom, if only for a while.
sentences.chinese: 蒂利克姆：我渴望自由，哪怕只有一段时间。

sentences.english: A relieved smile spread over his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上绽开了宽慰的笑容。

sentences.english: The by-pass crosses Wilton Lane shortly after a roundabout.
sentences.chinese: 这条旁道绕过环岛后不久就和威尔顿巷相交。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉，十字；十字架，十字形物
detailed_translations.english: an upright post of wood with another crossing it near the top, that people in the past were fastened to with nails and left to die on as a punishment
if two or more roads, lines, etc cross, or if one crosses another, they go across each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉的，相反的；乖戾的；生气的
detailed_translations.english: angry or annoyed

sentences.english: She was absolutely furious .
sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

sentences.english: Many of them work in low-paid insecure jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们当中的许多人都做着薪水低、不稳定的工作。

detailed_translations.english: a job, investment etc that is insecure does not give you a feeling of safety, because it might be taken away or lost at any time

name: shattered
trans: 感到震惊的，难过的，心烦意乱的

sentences.english: We had one person who walked out of an interview straight into a glass door. The glass shattered.
sentences.chinese: 我们面试过的一个人面试完之后径直走出去撞到了玻璃门上。玻璃都碎了。

sentences.english: This metaphor of shattered gravestones ran the length of the camp, splitting it in two, but did not extend eastward to the villa occupied by Commandant Goeth himself.
sentences.chinese: 这条被喻为破碎墓碑铺成的大道穿过了整个营地，将其一分为二，但这条路并没有向东延伸到高斯司令自己住的别墅。

name: disillusioned
trans: 不抱幻想的，理想破灭的

sentences.english: I've become very disillusioned with politics.
sentences.chinese: 我变得对政治非常失望。

detailed_translations.chinese: 醒悟的；幻想破灭的；不抱幻想的
detailed_translations.english: disappointed because you have lost your belief that someone is good, or that an idea is right

detailed_translations.chinese: 使幻想破灭（disillusion的过去分词）；唤醒

sentences.english: Don't worry, Xiao, I won't let you down.
sentences.chinese: 不要担心，肖，我不会让你失望的。

detailed_translations.english: If you let someone down, you disappoint them, by not doing something that you have said you will do or that they expected you to do

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

sentences.english: I fell down the steps and sprained my ankle .
sentences.chinese: 我从台阶上摔下来，扭伤了脚踝。

sentences.english: Rubin suffered a right ankle sprain when she rolled over on her ankle.
sentences.chinese: 鲁宾摔倒时身体压到了脚踝上导致右脚踝扭伤。

detailed_translations.english: to damage a joint in your body by suddenly twisting it
A sprain is the injury caused by spraining a joint

sentences.english: Manchester United had a goal disallowed.
sentences.chinese: 曼联队的一个入球被判无效。

detailed_translations.english: to officially refuse to accept something, because a rule has been broken

sentences.english: “Just doing it” shouldn’t be precise; it should come to you out of the blue.
sentences.chinese: “想做就做”并不应该是精确的；它应该是突然降临到你的头上。

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

name: punchline
trans: (故事、戏剧、笑话等中的)妙语，关键语

detailed_translations.chinese: 故事、笑话等中的妙语；关键语
detailed_translations.english: the last few words of a joke or story, that make it funny or surprising

sentences.english: Those would be you, a human, and grizzly bear, the thing that’s approaching you alarmingly fast.
sentences.chinese: 那就是你，一个人类，以及一头灰熊——它正在以惊人的速度向你奔来。

sentences.english: Those would be you, a human, and grizzly bear, the thing that’s approaching you alarmingly fast.
sentences.chinese: 一个是你——人类，另一个是灰熊——那个正在以惊人速度接近你的庞然大物。

sentences.english: The issue arouses strong passions.
sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.english: Gardening was her great passion.
sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的情感，激情；强烈的爱好，热爱
detailed_translations.english: a very strong belief or feeling about something

sentences.english: Are you going to give me the macho caveman act?
sentences.chinese: 你打算用大男子主义的粗暴方式来对我吗？

detailed_translations.english: someone who lived in a  cave  many thousands of years ago

sentences.english: The playwright does something remarkable in this scene, but without any impression of straining after an effect.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家在这场中有许多惊人妙笔，但并不给人留下竭力追求表面效果的印象。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成所有主要使用着的语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成世界上多种主要语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes plays

sentences.english: a respected elder statesman
sentences.chinese: 一位受人尊敬的政界元老

detailed_translations.english: a political or government leader, especially one who is respected as being wise and fair

sentences.english: Indeed, Facebook’s organization of information and relationships became, in a remarkably short period of time, a redoubt from the Web —a simpler, more habit-forming place.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，Facebook对信息和关系的组织，在一个显著的短期内，成了网页上的最后一块阵地 -- 一个简单的，更容易上瘾的地方。

sentences.english: Recently, I’ve discovered Qrank, a habit-forming multiple-choice trivia quiz built as an app for the iPhone and Facebook.
sentences.chinese: 最近，我发现了 Qrank，一个形成习惯的多选琐事问答的 iPhone 和 Facebook 的应用程序。

detailed_translations.english: a drug or activity that is habit-forming makes you want to keep taking it, keep doing it etc

sentences.english: Soon she was juggling five eggs.
sentences.chinese: 很快她就在抛接5个鸡蛋了。

detailed_translations.english: to keep three or more objects moving through the air by throwing and catching them very quickly

sentences.english: a packed courtroom
sentences.chinese: 挤满人的法庭

detailed_translations.english: extremely full of people

sentences.english: a blazing August afternoon
sentences.chinese: 八月一个炎热的午后

detailed_translations.english: extremely hot

sentences.english: Gail gave me a hesitant little smile.
sentences.chinese: 盖尔迟疑地对我微微一笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟疑的；踌躇的；犹豫不定的
detailed_translations.english: uncertain about what to do or say because you are nervous or unwilling

sentences.english: Anna squinted in the sudden bright sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 太阳光突然变强，安娜眯起了眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something with your eyes partly closed in order to see better
a condition of your eye muscles that makes each eye look in a slightly different direction

sentences.english: The audience cheered wildly.
sentences.chinese: 观众热烈欢呼。

sentences.english: Stop bouncing up and down on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 别在沙发上蹦来蹦去了。

detailed_translations.english: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it
the action of moving up and down on a surface

sentences.english: a little girl hopping and skipping
sentences.chinese: 一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩

detailed_translations.chinese: 单足跳跃，单足跳行；齐足跳跃，齐足跳行
detailed_translations.english: to move by jumping on one foot
to move by jumping on one foot
a short jump

sentences.english: a limp handshake
sentences.chinese: 无力的握手

sentences.english: His body suddenly went limp.
sentences.chinese: 他突然身子一软。

detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

sentences.english: As you lie on your own death-bed you will be as mystified about UFOs as you are today.
sentences.chinese: 当你躺在你自己临终的床上的时候，你仍将被不明飞行物所迷惑，就像你的今天被迷惑一模一样。

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

sentences.english: Steve couldn’t hide his amusement.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: The cats are a constant source of amusement to us.
sentences.chinese: 那些猫给我们带来无穷的乐趣。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you think something is funny

sentences.english: a look of desperation
sentences.chinese: 绝望的眼神

detailed_translations.english: the state of being desperate

sentences.english: He walked onwards to the head of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 他一直向前，走到湖泊源头。

detailed_translations.english: forwards

sentences.english: Those words bring nothing but pain and yet we beg for it.
sentences.chinese: 这些话除了伤痛什么也不能带来而我们却乞求它。

sentences.english: And even supposing that, because of his pride, he did not beg for freedom, I find it difficult to believe that this thought did not obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 且进一步假设，因为他的骄傲，他不会乞求自由，我发现这种假设很难令人信服，因为他从来就没有这种想法。

sentences.english: You never want to beg for a job, but you should act like you care about it.
sentences.chinese: 你不愿意去乞求一份工作，但是你应该表现得很在乎这份工作。

sentences.english: a messy room
sentences.chinese: 凌乱的房间

sentences.english: Sorry the place is so messy, I haven’t had time to clear up.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这地方又脏又乱，我一直没时间打扫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱的，散乱的；肮脏的，污秽的；麻烦的
detailed_translations.english: dirty or untidy

sentences.english: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数人退休的年纪，他准备要面对一项新事业。

sentences.english: I retired late that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我睡得晚。

detailed_translations.english: to stop working, usually because you have reached a certain age

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation

sentences.english: The cruelest insult, on the contrary, which can be offered to the unfortunate, is to appear to make light of their calamities.
sentences.chinese: 反过来说，对不幸者最大的侮辱似乎是不幸的境遇遭到轻视。

sentences.english: But on the few occasions when this had happened he could never think of anything to say and he suffered agonies of embarrassment at his dumbness.
sentences.chinese: 但在少数场合，当这种情况发生时，他却根本想不起说什么话来，对于自己的垭口无言感到极大的苦恼和困惑。

sentences.english: That is why dumbness is most often the highest expression of happiness of unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 因此沉默往往是幸福或不幸的最高表现形式。

sentences.english: Sometimes, Angela might still feel sad, missing her parents, feeling lonely, hating her dumbness or something.
sentences.chinese: 有时，安琪拉可能仍然失踪感到悲伤的时候，她的父母，觉得孤独，那恨他的沉默或什么的。

name: get one's mind off
trans: 转移某人的注意力，忘掉

detailed_translations.chinese: 转移某人的注意力，忘掉

sentences.english: There was no tactful way of phrasing what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 没有办法婉转地表达他想说的话。

sentences.english: a tactful man
sentences.chinese: 一个圆通的人

detailed_translations.english: not likely to upset or embarrass other people

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

sentences.english: I found him very arrogant and opinionated.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他非常傲慢和固执。

detailed_translations.english: expressing very strong opinions about things

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

sentences.english: There is no suggestion that clients have been sold inappropriate policies.
sentences.chinese: 没有迹象表明向客户出售过不适当的保险单。

detailed_translations.english: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

sentences.english: Communications that show up in your voice mail, or by email, courier, express mail, or snail mail should be welcome, too.
sentences.chinese: 通过语音邮件，电子邮件，信差，快递或普通邮件传递给你的信息都是受欢迎的（好的消息吧）。

sentences.english: The same goes for filing, checking voice mail, updating our calendars, checking our calendars, checking stats on stocks or web traffic, all of these tasks can and should be batched.
sentences.chinese: 与此类似的还有文件归档，查看语音邮件，更新日程表，检查日程表，留意股市信息或是网络交易信息，所有这些工作可以而且应该打包处理。

sentences.english: One is that customer service was an early and inevitable casualty when retailers responded to brutal competition by replacing employees with technology such as 1～800 numbers and voice mail.
sentences.chinese: 一方面当零售商应对残酷的竞争用1到800的数目和语音邮件等技术取代员工后，客户服务就成了早期的也是不可避免的受害者。

detailed_translations.english: a system which lets people leave recorded messages for you on your telephone when you are unable to answer it

sentences.english: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: the minister who conducted the funeral service
sentences.chinese: 主持葬礼的牧师

sentences.english: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
sentences.chinese: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍

sentences.english: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
sentences.chinese: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

detailed_translations.english: a religious ceremony for burying or cremating someone who has died

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: the other night
trans: 前两天夜里，不久前的某个夜里

detailed_translations.chinese: 前两天夜里，不久前的某个夜里

sentences.english: Calm down for a minute and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 冷静一下，听我说。

sentences.english: I'll try a herbal remedy to calm him down.
sentences.chinese: 我会尝试用一种香草疗法使他平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: If you calm down, or if someone calms you down, you become less angry, upset, or excited

sentences.english: Make time to socialise with friends – and also make time for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 抽时间进行社交——跟朋友聚聚，也是为自己抽出时间。

name: stumble
trans: 结结巴巴地说（或念）；绊倒

sentences.english: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.english: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.chinese: 我只踉跄了一下就把它弄进了黑暗中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌， 绊；结结巴巴地说话
detailed_translations.english: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Stumble is also a noun

sentences.english: As the day goes on, the pollen dries up and becomes hard.
sentences.chinese: 随着日子一天天过去，花粉变得又干又硬。

detailed_translations.english: If something dries up or if something dries it up, it loses all its moisture and becomes completely dry and shrivelled or hard

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

sentences.english: ...the right to silence in police interrogations.
sentences.chinese: …在警察审问时保持沉默的权利。

detailed_translations.english: An interrogation is the act of interrogating someone

sentences.english: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

sentences.english: The terms of the contract are very unclear.
sentences.chinese: 合同的条款非常含糊。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to understand or be sure about, so that there is doubt or confusion

sentences.english: The decline and fall of the American car industry is relatively easy to summarise, and the Hummer is its reductio.
sentences.chinese: 美国汽车业的衰亡相对比较容易概括总结，悍马正是美国汽车业的缩影。

sentences.english: He is not changing the rules; he is simply restating the policy that was established last year.
sentences.chinese: 他没有改变规定，只是把去年定下来的政策重新表述了一下。

detailed_translations.english: to say something again in a different way, so that it is clearer or more strongly expressed

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

name: over-emotional
trans: 过于激动的；过于敏感的

detailed_translations.chinese: 过于激动的；过于敏感的

sentences.english: Joe’s boyish charm
sentences.chinese: 乔身上的稚趣

sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

sentences.english: He unconsciously switched a tree with his cane when he talked to her.
sentences.chinese: 在和她讲话时，他无意识地用手里的鞭子抽打着一棵树。

sentences.english: He came across the jawbone of a 4.5 million-year-old marsupial.
sentences.chinese: 他偶然发现了一个450万年前的有袋动物的颌骨。

detailed_translations.english: If you come across something or someone, you find them or meet them by chance

sentences.english: Officers felt their point of view was not getting across to the generals.
sentences.chinese: 军官们觉得将军们还没有理解他们的观点。

detailed_translations.english: When an idea gets across or when you get it across, you succeed in making other people understand it

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

sentences.english: The prince drew up his forces in a strong defensive position.
sentences.chinese: 亲王将部队布成坚固的防御阵势。

sentences.english: The rockets are a purely defensive measure against nuclear attack.
sentences.chinese: 火箭弹纯粹是针对核攻击的防御性措施。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended to protect someone or something against attack

sentences.english: We did odd jobs like farm work and washing dishes.
sentences.chinese: 我们做了一些诸如干农活儿和洗盘子之类的零活儿。

sentences.english: It took a long time to wash the mud out of his hair.
sentences.chinese: 花了很长时间才把泥从他头发上洗掉。

detailed_translations.english: If you wash something, you clean it using water and usually a substance such as soap or detergent

sentences.english: And maybe she didn't murder her flatmate. And just maybe these two facts are entirely related.
sentences.chinese: 也许，诺克斯确曾经在某趟火车上与某个陌生男子发生了性关系，而她的确没有杀害她的室友，那么恰好，这两个事实被完全地相互关联了起来。

detailed_translations.english: someone who shares a flat with one or more other people

sentences.english: protective clothing
sentences.chinese: 防护服

sentences.english: Sunscreen provides a protective layer against the sun’s harmful rays.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜提供了一层抵挡阳光中有害光线的防护层。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended for protection

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

sentences.english: You'd be crazy to drop out.
sentences.chinese: 你要退学真是发疯了。

sentences.english: If your cards don't promise a winning outcome, you can drop out of the game without great loss.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的牌不能保证可以获得胜利的输出，你可以退出游戏而不会损失太多。

sentences.english: Morse was yet another name that appeared before walrus and seems to have spread to other languages only to drop out of use in English.
sentences.chinese: 莫尔斯是另一个在海象流传以前就存在的名称，并且似乎已经传播到其他语言而唯独在英语中退出了。

sentences.english: They’ve never actually given anyone the sack .
sentences.chinese: 他们从未真的辞退过什么人。

sentences.english: He got the sack for stealing.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷东西而被解雇。

sentences.english: She claimed she’d been threatened with the sack.
sentences.chinese: 她称自己受到过解雇的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is dismissed from their job
to dismiss someone from their job

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

sentences.english: The article was written in straight-forward, almost conversational language.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章用简单易懂、几乎是谈话式的语言写成。

detailed_translations.english: a conversational style, phrase etc is informal and commonly used in conversation

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

sentences.english: The staff are always courteous and helpful.
sentences.chinese: 员工们总是彬彬有礼、乐于帮助。

sentences.english: a courteous reply
sentences.chinese: 恭敬有礼的回答

detailed_translations.english: polite and showing respect for other people

sentences.english: Students tend to overuse certain words.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往会滥用某些词语。

detailed_translations.english: to use something too much, especially so that it is not effective any more or it is damaged

sentences.english: His article is stuffed with cliche.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章中满是一些陈词滥调。

sentences.english: A cliche, I know, and until then I had not grasped what that feels like.
sentences.chinese: 我知道过于陈词滥调，但是我知道我已经抓不住那种感觉了。

sentences.english: Enjoy your life when you're young – it's a true cliche that you only have your youth once – but work harder than most people think you should.
sentences.chinese: 当你年轻时，享受你的生活— 因为青春只有一次，这是陈词滥调— 但别忘了要比别人想象的更努力工作。

sentences.english: He was known for his poor grammar and punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 他以很差的语法和标点符号使用而出名。

detailed_translations.english: the marks used to divide a piece of writing into sentences, phrases etc

sentences.english: It’s a matter of common courtesy to acknowledge letters.
sentences.chinese: 确认收到来信是起码的礼貌。

sentences.english: The president paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 总统礼节性地拜访了明仁天皇。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour and respect for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的
detailed_translations.english: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect

name: sign-off
trans: 结束写信；结束广播节目

detailed_translations.chinese: 结束写信；结束广播节目

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

sentences.english: If there are people cowboy coding in your company, or even worse—on your team—do everything you can to change that for the sake of your customers.
sentences.chinese: 如果在您的公司（或者更糟糕，在您的团队）存在进行牛仔编码的人员，为了客户的利益着想，您应该竭尽全力地改变这种情况。

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

sentences.english: A look of annoyance crossed her face.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸上掠过一丝不快。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of slight anger

sentences.english: The abbreviation for Kansas is KS.
sentences.chinese: Kansas（堪萨斯州）的缩写是KS。

detailed_translations.english: a short form of a word or expression

sentences.english: Analysts believe that worries about the economy are overdone.
sentences.chinese: 分析人士认为对经济的担忧有些过火了。

sentences.english: Use a few drawings and photographs, but don’t overdo it.
sentences.chinese: 可使用一些图画和照片，但不要太多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…做得过分；使过于疲劳；对…表演过火；夸张
detailed_translations.english: to do something more than is suitable or natural

sentences.english: She lay motionless where she was, oblivious to pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一动不动地躺在原地，感觉不到疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: If you are oblivious to something or oblivious of it, you are not aware of it

sentences.english: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 货物一般在24小时内派送。

sentences.english: I was carrying dispatches from the ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 我正拿着大使的急件。

detailed_translations.english: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose
a message or report sent quickly from one military officer to another or between government officials

sentences.english: Information must be encrypted and privacy maintained in accordance with established policies, according to the role of the consumer.
sentences.chinese: 信息必须根据客户的角色按照确立的策略进行加密和以保密方式进行维护。

sentences.english: They aim to provide detailed editorial feedback in accordance with the standards of journals such as Nature and Science — where many of them have been published.
sentences.chinese: 他们的目标是按照《自然》和《科学》等期刊的标准提供详细的编辑反馈——他们之中的许多人在这些杂志上发表过论文。

sentences.english: ...the 236 revolutionary prisoners whose names are listed herewith.
sentences.chinese: ...这236名革命囚犯的名单附在本材料中。

sentences.english: I return herewith your papers.
sentences.chinese: 我随信退还你的文件。

detailed_translations.english: Herewith means with this document, text, or book. You can use herewith in a letter to say that you are enclosing something with it.

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

sentences.english: How then would this dinosaur have moved?
sentences.chinese: 那么这种恐龙要如何移动呢？

sentences.english: Like shark and dinosaur teeth they would break, but then regenerate.
sentences.chinese: 它们就像鲨鱼和恐龙的牙齿一样会断裂，但也会再生。

sentences.english: From there you can look straight down to the dinosaur fossils displayed on the floor below.
sentences.chinese: 从那儿往向下看，你可以看到陈列在地面上的恐龙化石。

detailed_translations.english: one of a group of  reptile s  that lived millions of years ago

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。
